data.meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
data.sentence: The word فِيهِ comes from the root ف ي and is associated with the meanings: Proposition which points to cause, space or time. In, into, amongst, in company with, during, with, of, for, for the sake of, upon, concerning, after, in comparison, about, among, on account of, respecting, by the side of, on, by, against, according to, in respect of.
The word أَمْ comes from the root ا م and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: Becoming separated, severed, disunited, cut off or distinctApparent, manifest, plain, clear, known, distinguished from anotherDisunion and unionComing forthSeparation or division between two things (e.g. land)An evidence, an indication, demonstration, proof, argument that is clear, manifest (intellectual or perceptive/perceived by sense), testimony of a witness
data.sentence: The word مُبِينٍ comes from the root ب ي ن and is associated with the meanings: Becoming separated, severed, disunited, cut off or distinctApparent, manifest, plain, clear, known, distinguished from anotherDisunion and unionComing forthSeparation or division between two things (e.g. land)An evidence, an indication, demonstration, proof, argument that is clear, manifest (intellectual or perceptive/perceived by sense), testimony of a witness
The word يَسْتَمِعُونَ comes from the root س م ع and is associated with the meanings: to hear, hearken, listen.

data.meanings: prevailed/overcame/predominated, firm/established in superior power/force, strength, possess power of dominion/sovereignty/rule/authority, sharp/eloquent, miracle
data.sentence: The word بِسُلْطَانٍ comes from the root س ل ط and is associated with the meanings: prevailed/overcame/predominated, firm/established in superior power/force, strength, possess power of dominion/sovereignty/rule/authority, sharp/eloquent, miracle

data.meanings: safety/security/freedom/immunity, to escape, salutation/greeting/peace, deliver/acknowledge, pay in advance, submit, sincerity, humility, submission/conformance/obedience, resign/quit/relinquish, to be in sound condition, well without blemish, gentle/tender/soft/elegant. Solomon/Sulaiman.
data.sentence: The word سُلَّمٌ comes from the root س ل م and is associated with the meanings: safety/security/freedom/immunity, to escape, salutation/greeting/peace, deliver/acknowledge, pay in advance, submit, sincerity, humility, submission/conformance/obedience, resign/quit/relinquish, to be in sound condition, well without blemish, gentle/tender/soft/elegant. Solomon/Sulaiman.

data.meanings: to come, to bring, come to pass, come upon, do, commit, arrive, pursue, put forth, show, increase, produce, pay, reach, happen, overtake, draw near, go, hit, meet, join, be engaged or occupied, perpetrate (e.g. crime), undertake
data.sentence: The word فَلْيَأْتِ comes from the root ا ت ي and is associated with the meanings: to come, to bring, come to pass, come upon, do, commit, arrive, pursue, put forth, show, increase, produce, pay, reach, happen, overtake, draw near, go, hit, meet, join, be engaged or occupied, perpetrate (e.g. crime), undertake
The word مُسْتَمِعُهُمْ comes from the root س م ع and is associated with the meanings: to hear, hearken, listen.
